text: [Music]
I do think that
law uh tends to be a profession that can
give rise to depression and and other uh
other forms of mental illness and other
difficulties and stress related illness
uh we did a survey recently on the site
where we asked our readers to mention U
which of various stress related uh work
related illnesses they had and the
results were really shocking I think I
can't remember the exact numbers but a
very high percentage of people had
suffered from Depression had suffered
from insomnia have had suffered from
various ailments I think it's true it is
a demanding profession you constantly on
call uh we recently posted an email from
a partner at a law firm that was sent
around to all the people at the law firm
saying you need to be checking your
email constantly I think the partner
said something like unless you were
asleep or in a tunnel you should be
reading your email um there's this
expectation that you're going to be
available 24/7 and that takes a toll the
other thing about the law and I think
one of the things that I don't miss
about it is you are essentially paid to
worry about other people's problems you
are paid to almost be a stress ball
people are going through something
horrible whether it is a contractual
dispute or a divorce or being accused of
a crime and they give their problems to
you so they don't have to worry about
them and so there's this thinking of
well well my lawyer is handling that and
it can be very stressful because you are
thinking well the how I do on this
particular project could depend could
determine whether or not my client goes
to jail for many years or whether or not
my client gets enough money from this
divorce settlement or whether or not my
company ends up uh my client company
ends up uh on the receiving end of a
multi-billion dollar judgment so it's a
very stressful profession so between the
stress and the long hours and the fact
that you're often dealing with people
who are in a state of conflict um it all
adds up
